idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780

descript.abstract:
This spatial dataset includes linear aquatic habitat reaches ("reaches") and descriptions primarily based on the available Oregon 1:100,000 scale routed hydrography for the specified subbasin (or partial subbasin). Each reach was defined as such because it has unique aquatic habitat characteristics which separate it from surrounding aquatic habitat, such as temperature, gradient, water quality, etc. The dataset also includes obstruction reaches, which may partially or fully impede focal species passage. The reaches were originally developed during the 2002-2004 Subbasin Planning effort to define habitat units to be attributed, rated, and processed by the Ecosystem Diagnosis and Treatment (EDT) model (see details below).
Many of the EDT ratings and results attributes are available in a separate table (edt_reach_attributes.dbf) that can be appended to the reaches via the unique item, REACHNAME. It is strongly recommended that data users consult the Mobrand Biometrics, Inc. EDT website (http://www.mobrand.com/MBI/edt.html) and the related Guidelines for Rating Selected Level 2 Environmental Attributes (http://www.mobrand.com/MBI/pdfs/AttributeRatings-June2004.pdf) to fully understand the EDT process and attribute definitions presented in this shapefile.
descript.purpose: These reaches were developed by the local Subbasin Planning team in coordination with the Technical Outreach and Assistance Team (TOAST; sponsored by the Columbia River Inter-Tribal Fish Commission). They were created to spatially define habitat units to be processed by Mobrand Biometrics' Ecosystem Diagnosis and Treatment (EDT; http://www.mobrand.com/MBI/edt.html) model as part of the Subbasin Planning effort mandated by the Northwest Power and Conservation Council (NPCC) in 2003. (http://www.nwcouncil.org/fw/subbasinplanning/Default.htm)
descript.supplinf:
This dataset is intended to be used by local Subbasin Planning team members as spatial reference for rated reaches and identified obstructions as has been required by the EDT model. Each reach has a unique name, which serves as a link between the spatial reaches and tabular EDT ratings and results. The reaches in this dataset were originally captured as events on the Oregon standard 1:100,000 (100K) hydrography provided by StreamNet. Reaches that do not correspond with the 100K hydrography have been digitized according to stream locations depicted on the 1:24,000 (24K) USGS DRG quadrangles.
The associated attribute table, edt_reach_attributes.dbf, may be linked to this shapefile via the REACHNAME item and contains many attributes titled "patient" and "template." All patient attributes are denoted with "P" and template attributes are denoted with "T." Definitions for these items are present in this document (see Entity and Attribute information, or consult the Table_Attribute_Def within the Version 2.5 of the Stream Reach Editor).
Patient - describes existing (current/contemporary) conditions of the diagnostic populations and their habitat.
Template - a hypothetical potential state, where conditions are as good as they can be within the watershed. The Template is sometimes approximated with a reconstruction of historic conditions, prior to European contact.

citeinfo.origin: Local subbasin planners and the Technical Outreach and Assistance Team (TOAST; supported by the Columbia River Inter-Tribal Fish Commission)
citeinfo.title: Walla Walla Subbasin EDT Reaches
citeinfo.othercit: These reaches were developed and approved during an April 8-10 reach delineation workshop held in Mission, Oregon. The reaches were subsequently edited and finalized by TOAST and local subbasin biologists in September, 2003.

theme.themekey: subbasin reaches, Walla Walla River, fish habitat

idinfo.accconst: The data presented here are meant for informational and display purposes only and were created with the best information available at the time of publication. These data do not represent any legal boundaries or information.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique 13-digit Longitude / Latitude stream identifier assigned by StreamNet
Stream name assigned by StreamNet or found on the USGS 24K digital raster graphic (DRG) files
Unique reach name; reach names match those submitted in the Stream Reach Editor (SRE), so data can be linked via this item.
State which claimed responsibility for mapping and modeling the reach. (OR = Oregon, WA = Washington)
Geographic area that encompasses multiple reaches. Used for reporting limiting factors within EDT.
Length from EDT (miles) for patient (current) scenario
Gradient value from EDT (%) for patient (current) scenario
Confinement of stream channel by surrounding terrain. From EDT data for patient (current) scenario.
Consecutive numbering of reaches, from mouth to headwaters
EDT number for unique indentification in the model.
